page.title: 10Sport In Notgrove
page.content: The Notgrove Village Cricket Club, reformed about 3 years ago, plays on a beautiful pitch near the Manor. The teas are served in the village hall. The team is made up of enthusiasts mainly from the 2 nearby villages of Turkdean and Cold Aston. They play a full Summer programme of maybe a home game on Saturday, and an away game on Sunday. Ajoining the Cricket Ground is a private hard surface Tennis Court, owned by the Manor and used by them and their invited guests. There are no football, hockey or skittles teams in the village, but darts are played in the village hall. On Monday evenings children of the village are allowed to swim in a private swimming pool in one of the gardens of the village.
